sentence.Network_en: Faced with such detraction, scientists characteristically retort that science, unlike witchcraft, works.
sentence.Network_cn: 面对诋毁, 科学家们出于天性给予反驳,宣称科学不是巫术, 确实有效.

sentence.Network_en: Envy has no other quality But that of detraction from virtue.
sentence.Network_cn: 嫉妒除了损坏美德外,别无可取之处.

sentence.Network_en: Envy has no other quality but that of detraction from virtue.
sentence.Network_cn: 嫉妒除了毁损美德外,别无他用.

list.abs: Something that impairs or detracts from physical perfection ; a defect ., 缺陷身体完美状态上的损害或损伤 ; 缺陷.
That does not detract from how impressive Wang has been this season ., 但这并没有降低他这个球季是多麽的令人印象深刻.
大学综合英语教材2的单词表？ ... ... be involved in sth 与。。。。有关系，有牵连 detract from sth 使逊色 share in sth 分享；分担.
detract vi.削弱，贬低detract from 有损于，降低devastating adj.破坏性的，毁灭性的
testimony that only detracts from the strength of the plaintiff ' s case ., 仅仅降低了原告案情有力的证词.

means.word_mean: 2. the act of discrediting or detracting from someone's reputation (especially by slander);

sentences.sentence: "let it be no detraction from his merits to say he is plainspoken"
